<pre class="prettyprint lang-wiki"><table><tr
id=sl_svn6_1><td class="source">#summary Welcome to the KF-Ray Project Wiki<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_2><td class="source">#sidebar TOCArticles<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_3><td class="source">&lt;wiki:toc /&gt;<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_4><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_5><td class="source">= What is KF-Ray =<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_6><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_7><td class="source">== Introduction ==<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_8><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_9><td class="source">_KF-Ray_ is a project we started in February 2009 at [http://www.polytech.upmc.fr/ Polytech&#39;Paris], an engineers&#39; graduate school of the University Pierre and Marie Curie (UPMC) with Jean-Baptiste Mouret as tutor.<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_10><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_11><td class="source">The v1.0.1 is the last version.<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_12><td class="source">This version is shown at the end of the year.<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_13><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_14><td class="source">We want to keep continuing this project because it is really interesting there are so many things to add and maybe one day someone may find it useful (we hope !).<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_15><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_16><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_17><td class="source">==v1.0.1 Features==<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_18><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_19><td class="source"> * Effects<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_20><td class="source">  ** Reflections, shadows, refractions (in progress transparency is available)<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_21><td class="source">  ** Bump mapping<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_22><td class="source"> * Objects<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_23><td class="source">  ** Lights (punctual)<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_24><td class="source">  ** Spheres<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_25><td class="source">  ** Planes<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_26><td class="source"> * Reflectance models <br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_27><td class="source">  ** Diffuse (Lambert)<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_28><td class="source">  ** Specular (Blinn-Phong)<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_29><td class="source"> * Procedural textures<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_30><td class="source">  ** Perlin noise (turbulence, wood, marbel)<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_31><td class="source">  ** Checker<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_32><td class="source"> * Perspective projection with a right handed coordinate system<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_33><td class="source"> * High Performance Parallel Computing<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_34><td class="source">  ** Work with several computers in the same time<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_35><td class="source">  ** Dynamic Load Balancing (master/slave)<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_36><td class="source"> * Need only few libraries<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_37><td class="source"> * Load personalised description files with easy syntax<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_38><td class="source"> * Easy to use with a simple user interface in GTK+<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_39><td class="source"> * Well-documented code easy to read and modify (Doxygen)<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_40><td class="source"> * Can render some animations (in progress)<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_41><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_42><td class="source">Consult the [TODO Todo list] to see what would be the new features of KF-Ray !<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_43><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_44><td class="source">= Manual =<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_45><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_46><td class="source">    * [Manual KF-Ray User-Guide (Manual)]<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_47><td class="source">    <br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_48><td class="source">    <br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_49><td class="source">= Developpment =<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_50><td class="source">    <br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_51><td class="source">==Libraries==<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_52><td class="source"> * Lex/Yacc, a compiler or parser for interpreting and reading the description file language<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_53><td class="source"> * GTK+ a library to build graphical user interfaces<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_54><td class="source"> * MPI for parallel computing<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_55><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_56><td class="source">==Tools==<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_57><td class="source"> * VI, Gedit as text editor<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_58><td class="source"> * Codeblocks as IDE<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_59><td class="source"> * gdb, valgrind, ddd as debuging tools<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_60><td class="source"> * Doxygen to document the header files<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_61><td class="source"> * Imagemagick to see the images and animations<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_62><td class="source"> * Subversion (SVN) a version control system<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_63><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_64><td class="source">==Misc==<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_65><td class="source">    * [CodingStyle Coding Rules for KF-Ray]<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_66><td class="source">    * [Links Useful Links]<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_67><td class="source"><br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_68><td class="source">= To help us =<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_69><td class="source">    * Report bugs and ask questions by visiting the [http://code.google.com/p/kf-ray/issues/list KF-Ray Issue Tracker]. ** Bugs are filed [http://code.google.com/p/kf-ray/issues/entry here]<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_70><td class="source">    * Contribute to the development by helping fix bugs and adding new features<br></td></tr
><tr
id=sl_svn6_71><td class="source">    * Contribute to the documentation and translation in English<br></td></tr
></table></pre>

<pre class="prettyprint"><table width="100%"><tr class="cursor_stop cursor_hidden"><td></td></tr></table></pre>
</td>
</tr></table>

 <script type="text/javascript" src="http://kibbles.googlecode.com/files/kibbles-1.3.1.comp.js"></script>
 <script type="text/javascript">
 var lastStop = null;
 var initilized = false;
 
 function updateCursor(next, prev) {
 if (prev && prev.element) {
 prev.element.className = 'cursor_stop cursor_hidden';
 }
 if (next && next.element) {
 next.element.className = 'cursor_stop cursor';
 lastStop = next.index;
 }
 }
 
 function pubRevealed(data) {
 updateCursorForCell(data.cellId, 'cursor_stop cursor_hidden');
 if (initilized) {
 reloadCursors();
 }
 }
 
 function draftRevealed(data) {
 updateCursorForCell(data.cellId, 'cursor_stop cursor_hidden');
 if (initilized) {
 reloadCursors();
 }
 }
 
 function draftDestroyed(data) {
 updateCursorForCell(data.cellId, 'nocursor');
 if (initilized) {
 reloadCursors();
 }
 }
 function reloadCursors() {
 kibbles.skipper.reset();
 loadCursors();
 if (lastStop != null) {
 kibbles.skipper.setCurrentStop(lastStop);
 }
 }
 // possibly the simplest way to insert any newly added comments
 // is to update the class of the corresponding cursor row,
 // then refresh the entire list of rows.
 function updateCursorForCell(cellId, className) {
 var cell = document.getElementById(cellId);
 // we have to go two rows back to find the cursor location
 var row = getPreviousElement(cell.parentNode);
 row.className = className;
 }
 // returns the previous element, ignores text nodes.
 function getPreviousElement(e) {
 var element = e.previousSibling;
 if (element.nodeType == 3) {
 element = element.previousSibling;
 }
 if (element && element.tagName) {
 return element;
 }
 }
 function loadCursors() {
 // register our elements with skipper
 var elements = CR_getElements('*', 'cursor_stop');
 var len = elements.length;
 for (var i = 0; i < len; i++) {
 var element = elements[i]; 
 element.className = 'cursor_stop cursor_hidden';
 kibbles.skipper.append(element);
 }
 }
 function toggleComments() {
 CR_toggleCommentDisplay();
 reloadCursors();
 }
 function keysOnLoadHandler() {
 // setup skipper
 kibbles.skipper.addStopListener(
 kibbles.skipper.LISTENER_TYPE.PRE, updateCursor);
 // Set the 'offset' option to return the middle of the client area
 // an option can be a static value, or a callback
 kibbles.skipper.setOption('padding_top', 50);
 // Set the 'offset' option to return the middle of the client area
 // an option can be a static value, or a callback
 kibbles.skipper.setOption('padding_bottom', 100);
 // Register our keys
 kibbles.skipper.addFwdKey("n");
 kibbles.skipper.addRevKey("p");
 kibbles.keys.addKeyPressListener(
 'u', function() { window.location = detail_url; });
 kibbles.keys.addKeyPressListener(
 'r', function() { window.location = detail_url + '#publish'; });
 
 kibbles.keys.addKeyPressListener('j', gotoNextPage);
 kibbles.keys.addKeyPressListener('k', gotoPreviousPage);
 
 
 kibbles.keys.addKeyPressListener('h', toggleComments);
 
 }
 window.onload = function() {keysOnLoadHandler();};
 </script>

<script type="text/javascript">
 
 // the comment form template
 var form = '<div class="draft"><div class="header"><span class="title">Draft comment:</span></div>' +
 '<div class="body"><form onsubmit="return false;"><textarea id="$ID">$BODY</textarea><br>$ACTIONS</form></div>' +
 '</div>';
 // the comment "plate" template used for both draft and published comment "plates".
 var draft_comment = '<div class="draft" ondblclick="$ONDBLCLICK">' +
 '<div class="header"><span class="title">Draft comment:</span><span class="actions">$ACTIONS</span></div>' +
 '<pre id="$ID" class="body">$BODY</pre>' +
 '</div>';
 var published_comment = '<div class="published">' +
 '<div class="header"><span class="title"><a href="$PROFILE_URL">$AUTHOR:</a></span><div>' +
 '<pre id="$ID" class="body">$BODY</pre>' +
 '</div>';

 function showPublishInstructions() {
 var element = document.getElementById('review_instr');
 if (element) {
 element.className = 'opened';
 }
 }
 function revsOnLoadHandler() {
 // register our source container with the commenting code
 var paths = {'svn6': '/wiki/Welcome.wiki'}
 _setup('kf-ray', 'svn6', paths, 'b818d37e113cb208cd267f6385c07459',
 CR_BrowseIntegrationFactory);
 // register our hidden ui elements with the code commenting code ui builder.
 CR_registerLayoutElement('form', form);
 CR_registerLayoutElement('draft_comment', draft_comment);
 CR_registerLayoutElement('published_comment', published_comment);
 
 // register our source container with the commenting code
 // in this case we're registering the container and the revison
 // associated with the contianer which may be the primary revision
 // or may be a previous revision against which the primary revision
 // of the file is being compared.
 CR_registerSourceContainer(document.getElementById('lines'), 'svn6');
 
 CR_registerActivityListener(CR_ACTIVITY_TYPE.REVEAL_DRAFT_PLATE, showPublishInstructions);
 
 CR_registerActivityListener(CR_ACTIVITY_TYPE.REVEAL_PUB_PLATE, pubRevealed);
 CR_registerActivityListener(CR_ACTIVITY_TYPE.REVEAL_DRAFT_PLATE, draftRevealed);
 CR_registerActivityListener(CR_ACTIVITY_TYPE.DISCARD_DRAFT_COMMENT, draftDestroyed);
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 var initilized = true;
 reloadCursors();
 }
 window.onload = function() {keysOnLoadHandler(); revsOnLoadHandler();};
</script>
